p: Mechanisms other than adaptation to climate-imposed selection may also play an important role in the greater phenotypic plasticity of Fagus sylvatica and Quercus petraea. For example, these species may have more efficient mechanisms for dealing with biotic interactions, such as competition, antagonism, mutualism, defenses against insect and pest attacks, and a greater capacity to recover from such attacks. This hypothesis appears plausible in light of the recent decimation of natural conifer populations by beetle infestations linked to ongoing climate change ( Allen et al., 2010; Alfaro et al., 2014).
